oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ethyl Venson
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: portraits; Venson, Ethyl; 1950s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Along with her husband, Ransom Q. Venson, she founded the Cotton Makers' Jubilee in 1935. Ethyl Venson was also the first woman and first African-American to be appointed to the board of the Memphis Housing Authority. This photo was taken in Chicago on Easter Day in 1950.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Memphis & Shelby County Room Photograph Collection
